StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: Data Coordinating Center, Microbiome of the Lung and Respiratory Track, Lung HIV Microbiome Project (LHMP)

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: We acknowledge the contribution of the investigators and staff of Lung HIV Microbiome Project (LHMP) Study Group: Clinical Centers at Indiana University, University of California San Francisco, University of Colorado, Denver, University of Michigan, Ann Arbor, University of Pennsylvania and University of Pittsburgh. Sequencing Centers at University of California San Francisco, University of Colorado, Boulder, University of Michigan, Ann Arbor, University of Pennsylvania, University of Pittsburgh and Washington University in St. Louis. The data coordinating center George Washington University, The Biostatistics Center and project office at the National Institutes of Health Heart, Lung and Blood Institute.
Policy.ic_specific_access_term: There are two consent groups for the Data Coordinating Center, Microbiome of the Lung and Respiratory Track, Lung HIV Microbiome Project (LHMP) study: 1) General Research Use (GRU) - The informed consent documents signed by the Lung HIV Microbiome Project (LHMP) study participants allows de-identified data (phenotype and sequencing) to be used for research purposes by investigators who request the data via the controlled-access review process. The sequencing files are from bronchoalveolar lavage, bronchoalveolar lavage prewash control, oral wash, oral wash control and extraction control specimens. 2) Disease-Specific (Human Immunodeficiency Virus) - Use of the data must be related to Human Immunodeficiency Virus. LHMP study participants who limited the future research use of their de-identified data (phenotype and sequencing) to HIV Related Studies only. They are not included in the General Research Use group. Use of the data is limited only by the terms of the model Data Use Certification.

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Human Immunodeficiency Virus)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-HIV

The informed consent documents signed by the Lung HIV Microbiome Project (LHMP) study participants allows de-identified data (phenotype and sequencing) to be used for research purposes by investigators who request the data via the controlled-access review process. The sequencing files are from bronchoalveolar lavage, bronchoalveolar lavage prewash control, oral wash, oral wash control and extraction control specimens.
